results.content:
-2 Stars for blurry video, my god, it's an online course.  You shouldn't have blurry video.  Hurts my eyes.
-.5 Stars not updated, it's from 2013; however, it is a basic introductory course, so it's condoned up to the point where you start hearing comments like 'as we did in the javascript course' and such.  What Javascript course?  This course was promoted to me as a stand-alone no-experience required course.  So I get lost when I hear things 'like in Javascript'.  It's nonesense as a new student.

Video improved after 3rd video, but the course remained very disorganized half-baked PHP basics; a continuation of some other course.  Course definitely not updated.  They should take it down or bring the content current.  I do not recommend it at all.  You'll get more out of a YouTube video than this course.

results.content: Course was good - very brief.  Very quick, high-level overview of PHP.  The instructor kept referring to a JavaScript section/course, so I'm not sure if this used to be part of a larger course, or was intended to be taken after another one.  It would be a good refresher or introduction, but you would definitely need to take another course for more in-depth information.

results.content:
This course is a brief but good introduction to the basics of PHP language. The delivery is mostly straight to the point and I admired the instructor's spontaneity - especially the moments where he makes some small mistake and quickly notices it and corrects it. I think many instructors would simply cut that part out of the video.

The downside is the lack of any quizzes and assignments. Having them would greatly improve the experience and give the audience the feeling of really following a course, instead of merely watching a series of videos.

results.content: This is a very good and informative course. It freshes up on some of the basics of PHP and gives a push to a beginner to learn more. However, when I tried to follow along with the instructor's code, there were some silly mistakes that he discovered some moments later, but it was confusing to me because I tried to copy the code, got the same errors and struggled only to find out later that the error was caused by a silly line of code. Anyway, maybe that helped us learn more about debugging in PHP but it wasn't pleasant during the process.

results.content: This is an adequate introductory course for getting your toes wet in PHP, but you will need to find another course or courses to make you into a competent PHP programmer. The instructor touches on Object Oriented Programming in PHP, but does not provide much detail about using it to maximize your productivity and create better programs (perhaps that is too much to expect in a beginner level course). He hints at some introductory material for SQL, but it never materializes. I would like to have seen the development of a small sample application that actually related to generating some useful HTML that can't be easily done with CSS. I don't know PHP well enough to tell what else is missing. If the instructor improves the course significantly, I will consider revising this review.

results.content:
The instructor keeps referring to a JavaScript course that he's indicating his student just recently took.  I've never taken a javascript course and certainly not prior to this course.    This PHP course stands alone and no prerequisite was identified.  The instructor shouldn't assume his student knows  JavaScript and should quit saying what he's doing in PHP is the same as "we" did in the JavaScript course. It's kind of annoying.

Also, his keyboard is very loud.  The key clacking should be edited out of his video/audio sessions.

Lastly, I'm not seeing the basics of PHP that I thought I had signed up for.  He doesn't even tell us how to structure a PHP statement.  When to use commas, single quotes, double quotes, brackets, or parentheses.  I'm not getting that basic kind of information.

Wow!  That ended pretty quickly.  I was hoping I would get some insight into how to use PHP in an actual html or php document.  What usual php statements are used in Wordpress themes and such.  Pretty disappointed with this course although it was free so I can't complain one bit.

Thanks.

Lastly, I'm not seeing the basics of PHP that I thought I had signed up for. He doesn't even tell us how to structure a PHP statement. When to use commas, single quotes, double quotes, brackets, or parentheses. I'm not getting that basic kind of information.
